Description.value: Vanilla gun sounds are nice and high quality but too loud, and there is no way to configure their volume independently. For now I just replaced all gun sounds with existing suppressed vanilla sounds, and muted all repetitive crafting sounds so we can stay as long we want on crafting interface. I dont know how to create sound replacements yet (in .unity3d format, as it wont accept .wav .mp3 etc files). Wish we had independent volume controls for guns, animals, npcs, player sounds etc. The thunder binary patcher can be run on windows too, you just need to have perl installed and run this on the windows cmd.exe command terminal prompt (you must run it on the folder where resources.assets file is). It will keep only the a_thunder3 enabled, that is a nice and low volume thunder sound: perl -i -w -0777pe 's/(a_thunder[1245])(.*?)(resources[.]resource)/$1\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x01\x00\x00\x00\x44\xac\x00\x00\x10\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x80\x3e\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x00\x01\x01\x01\x00\x12\x00\x00\x00$3/sg' resources.assets
